Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394924) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394924)
